p: Hydroxychloroquine is a more soluble hydroxy-analogue of chloroquine (CQ), which was first synthesized by Hans Andersag in 1934, and proven by military testing during World War II as a safe antimalarial used successfully during the 20th century to prevent and treat malaria in endemic areas [ 5]. In the 1990s studies revealed that hydroxychloroquine (HCQ), has immunomodulatory properties; leading to its use in the treatment of autoimmune diseases such as Lupus and rheumatoid arthritis [ 5, 6].
